page.title: 04Beverstone Castle:Chapel.
page.content: Of particular interest inside the castle is the magnificent Berkeley Chapel which is on the second floor of the western wing.The room has a stone-vaulted roof with carved bosses.On the walls of the chapel,surrounded by fine carvings are the piscina,where the holy vessels were washed and the sedilia,where the priest sat.An unusual feature is the stone seat near the window.It has been suggested that this was for the commander of the castle and that it enabled him to keep an eye open for invaders even when he was saying his prayers!
